issues.title: Missing Required AED Training Requirements
issues.description: California law requires that at least one employee trained in CPR and AED use be present during school hours and school-sponsored activities. The current documents only require distribution of informational brochures but do not establish the mandatory training requirement or ensure trained personnel availability.

legal_citations.text: "The school shall ensure that at least one employee trained in the operation and use of an automated external defibrillator is available on the school grounds during normal school hours and during school-sponsored activities."

issues.required_language: The district shall ensure that at least one employee trained in CPR and the operation and use of an automated external defibrillator is available on school grounds during normal school hours and during school-sponsored activities. Training shall meet standards established by the American Heart Association or American Red Cross.

issues.title: Missing AED Maintenance and Testing Requirements
issues.description: California law requires specific maintenance, testing, and record-keeping procedures for AEDs. While the policy mentions maintenance guidelines will be developed, neither document establishes the required maintenance schedule or documentation requirements.

legal_citations.text: "The automated external defibrillator shall be maintained and tested according to the manufacturer's operational guidelines and shall be checked for readiness after each use and at least once every 30 days if the unit has not been used."

issues.required_language: AEDs shall be maintained and tested according to manufacturer's operational guidelines and checked for readiness after each use and at least once every 30 days if unused. Documentation of all maintenance, testing, and readiness checks shall be maintained.

issues.title: Missing Emergency Medical Services Notification Requirement
issues.description: California law requires immediate notification of emergency medical services when an AED is used. This critical emergency response requirement is not addressed in either document.

legal_citations.text: "Any person who renders emergency care or treatment on a person in cardiac arrest by using an automated external defibrillator shall activate the emergency medical services system as soon as possible."

issues.required_language: When an AED is used on any person, emergency medical services (911) shall be activated immediately, regardless of the outcome of the AED use.

issues.title: Missing Physician Authorization for AED Program
issues.description: While not always strictly required, many California school districts obtain physician oversight for their AED programs to ensure medical appropriateness and provide additional liability protection.

legal_citations.text: "A person who has not previously been trained in the use of an automated external defibrillator may use an automated external defibrillator that has been designed to be used by the general public if... the person acts under the supervision of a licensed physician."

issues.required_language: The district's AED program shall operate under the supervision of a licensed physician who shall provide medical oversight and review of the program.
